Package net.aifusion.cql

This package implements a query facility based on the DMTF CIM Query Language (CQL). Since CQL was designed for CIM Version 2, but the Fusion metamodel is based on CIM Version 3, there are differences in the query language as well.

The package exposes a single class CimQuery that can be used to query instances within a repository.

Currently, while the majority of the CQL specification can be parsed as a valid query, the actual query engine is only partially implemented. Thus, mileage on a specific query may vary, especially for queries that involve joins. The Basic Query form defined in DSP0202 should, however, work: 

 SELECT * FROM class_name WHERE <selection expression>

The query will return a list of structure values that meet the desired expression. Result Set operations (DISTINCT, FIRST, ORDER BY) are not implemented, nor are aggregation functions (e.g., COUNT, MIN, MAX, SUM, MEAN, MEDIAN).

In addition, The construct $identifier$ can be used in the query to define "delayed constants" that can be set within the query using CimQuery.setVariable(String, net.aifusion.metamodel.DataValue) after it is parsed. This is useful, for example to reuse the same query with different values in the selection expression without the overhead of re-constructing the query each time.

Author:
Sharad Singhal
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    CimQuery
    Class to implement a query for elements in a repository
